p: Among them, 1.2% (95% CI 0.8 to 1.7) were infected with T. pallidum, 5.6% (95% CI 4.7 to 6.5) with HIV, 7.4% (95% CI 6.5 to 8.5) with HBV and 2.7% (95% CI 2.1 to 3.4) with HCV. Only 0.1% (95% CI 0 to 0.4) were co-infected with HIV and T. pallidum, 0.2% (95% CI 0 to 0.5) with HBV and T. pallidum, and 0.2% (95% CI 0 to 0.5) with HCV and T. pallidum (TableÂ 2).
